Unit Master Documentation

Welcome to Unit Master

A guided document to help you register new single members quickly and correctly.

Unit Master is a comprehensive front-to-back financial operations and capital markets platform designed for asset managers and investment institutions. This guide focuses on one key task: registering a new Single Member. Follow the steps below in order, and you will be able to capture accurate member data, meet compliance requirements, and prepare accounts for contributions and withdrawals.

New Member Registration – Single Members
Approx. completion time: 3–5 minutes
Data capture and compliance
1

Getting started: opening the “Add New Member” page

Begin by logging into Unit Master with your username and password. When the main dashboard opens, look at the left-hand navigation and click Members. This brings you to the members area where you can see existing records.

To capture a new person, click the button labelled Add a New Member. The system will open the registration wizard and guide you through the process step by step.

2

Choosing the correct member type Single Member

At the top of the form, locate the field called Member Type. Open the drop-down list and select Single Member whenever you are registering an individual who is joining in their own name and not as part of a joint account, company or group.

Selecting the correct type ensures that the system shows the right set of fields and rules for this member.

3

Capturing personal details

Complete the Personal Details section carefully. You will be asked for:

  • Salutation (for example, Mr, Mrs, Ms)
  • First Name and Surname
  • Date of Birth, selected from the calendar control
  • Gender
  • Country of Birth
  • Marital Status such as Single or Married

These fields uniquely identify the member and are often required for regulatory and reporting purposes, so check spelling and dates before moving on.

4

Adding contact information

In the Contact Details section, provide clear and up-to-date information so that statements and notifications reach the member:

  • District or area of residence
  • Telephone Number and Mobile Phone Number
  • Email Address for digital communication
  • Physical Address including street, town or village
  • Receive Statement Via, indicating whether the member prefers statements by email or post

Double-check all phone numbers and email addresses to reduce the risk of failed deliveries.

5

Recording next of kin details

Every member should have at least one Next of Kin on file. Capture:

  • The next of kin’s Full Name
  • The Relationship to the member, for example Father, Spouse or Sister
  • A reliable Phone Number

This contact can be used for emergencies or important account matters where the institution needs to reach someone on the member’s behalf.

6

Completing statutory details Compliance

The Statutory Details panel supports KYC and regulatory requirements. Provide honest and complete answers for:

  • Is Client Resident – choose Yes or No
  • Tax PIN / TIN – the member’s registered tax number
  • Income Range – select the most suitable bracket
  • Adverse Media Screening Done – confirm whether checks have been completed

Accurate statutory information protects both the member and the institution and may be required for audits.

7

Employment details (when applicable)

If you indicate that the client is employed, additional employment fields will appear. Capture information such as the member’s occupation and employer details as requested.

These data points can later be used for risk assessment and loan evaluation. If the member is not employed, simply leave this option set to No and proceed to the next step.

8

Setting up account details

Under Account Details, you configure how the member participates in the fund:

  • Select the Fund Name the member is joining
  • Choose the appropriate Fee Category
  • Indicate whether the member will Withdraw Dividends
  • Assign an Agent Name responsible for the account

These settings control fees, income distribution and relationship management, so always confirm them with the member before saving.

9

Providing bank information

Decide whether to capture Bank Details now. If you select Yes, the form will ask for:

  • Bank Name and Branch
  • Currency of the bank account
  • Account Number
  • Account Type, such as Savings or Current

If you choose No, these fields can be captured later, but note that withdrawals cannot be processed until valid bank details are on record.

10

Reviewing and completing the registration Finish

Before you submit the form, take a moment to review each section for spelling errors, missing fields or incorrect selections. When you are satisfied, click Finish to complete the registration.

The system automatically validates the data. Any missing or invalid fields will be highlighted in red so that you can correct them immediately. Once validation passes, the new member is added to the members list and is ready for contributions, investments and other transactions.
